page.title: 01STOBSHEIL RESERVOIR
page.content: Stobsheil Reservoir in the central feature of this area nestling in the hillfoots of the Lammermuir Hills. The ground level ranges from hilly unfenced moorland with some gorse in the east and south of the block to undulating arable farmland in the north-west which is divided into small fields by post and wire fencing. There are shelter belts of coniferous trees forming windbreaks and creating excellent fertile land. Sheep farming on the hills and crops, primarily barley on the lower land. There is a 400 ku. Electricity power line commissioned late in 1985 with the pylons running north to south following the valley and skirting the western edge of Stobsheil Reservoir.
